attributes.action: Continue with local tier approach and not national lockdown
attributes.additional_details: The economy is being irrevocably impacted by lockdowns with rising numbers of unemployed and failing businesses.  Deaths from covid-19 are mainly in the older age groups ( average age 82 years old) therefore advice on how to shield should be given to those vulnerable groups whilst the rest of the population get on with life. Eventually herd immunity will be reached or the virus will mutate into a less virulent pestilence so we can live with it as we live each year with standard flu.
attributes.background:
Continue with local short term restrictions in areas of rising hospital admissions do not implement national lockdown on the 5th November.
Allow food establishments to close at 11pm so that they can support two evening sittings. 
Gyms stay open in all tiers to support physical and mental health.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Repeal second National Lockdown
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557045

Fund & provide services to allow the vulnerable to shield & re-open the economy
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552023

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

Repeal Covid-19 Restrictions on opening hours
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551634
